column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/1cbbca3418d76b9209493131f292f1bc9ebb25f0 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
What harm is there in leaving this? Why would we drop support for whatever platform(s) need it?\n
Agreed, there's no harm in leaving this for now.\n
Thought we could cleanup old stuff because we recently switched to more recent Boost versions.\n
Switching versions for Windows binaries does not mean mandating newer dependencies for the code itself.\n

What we ship with gitian are the _recommended_ dependency versions. The _minimum required_ dependency versions shouldn't be bumped unless really necessary.\nThis is because "stable"/"enterprise" linux distributions tend to have very old versions of dependencies. The same for tool chains for old versions of OSX (in the case of this LLVM workaround).\n
